message.content:
Sure, here’s a 7-day meal plan that is free from the listed restrictions (dairy, milk-based yogurt, garlic, honey, almonds, almond butter, pistachios, and cashews). The meals are balanced to provide a variety of nutrients and flavors. Each day will consist of three meals: breakfast, lunch, and dinner, along with snacks where necessary.

**Day 1:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Scrambled eggs with spinach and tomatoes
- Whole grain toast (ensure no dairy-based spreads are used)
- Orange juice

_Lunch:_
- Quinoa salad with mixed vegetables and olive oil dressing
- Lentil soup

_Dinner:_
- Baked lemon herb chicken breast
- Roasted sweet potatoes
- Steamed broccoli

_Snack:_
- Fresh fruit (like apples or berries)
- Rice cakes

**Day 2:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Oatmeal made with plant-based milk, topped with sliced banana and chia seeds

_Lunch:_
- Turkey and avocado wrap (using dairy-free tortilla)
- Side of mixed green salad with a lemon-tahini dressing

_Dinner:_
- Stir-fried tofu with bell peppers and bok choy
- Brown rice
- Edamame on the side for protein

_Snack:_
- Carrot sticks
- Hummus for dipping

**Day 3:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Smoothie with plant-based milk, kale, pineapple, and a scoop of pea protein powder

_Lunch:_
- Chickpea salad with cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, dressed in lemon juice and olive oil
- Gluten-free bread (if necessary)

_Dinner:_
- Grilled salmon fillet
- Quinoa pilaf with peas and carrots
- Roasted asparagus

_Snack:_
- Handful of mixed berries
- A small handful of pumpkin seeds

**Day 4:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Whole grain waffles topped with a compote made from unsweetened applesauce, cinnamon, and a touch of maple syrup (ensure no dairy is used)

_Lunch:_
- Black bean and vegetable soup
- Side garden salad with vinaigrette

_Dinner:_
- Grilled shrimp skewers with a side of couscous
- Sautéed kale with lemon and garlic-free seasoning

_Snack:_
- A small serving of popcorn (make sure it's unsalted and not made with butter)
- Diced cucumber with a squeeze of lime juice

**Day 5:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Chia seed pudding made with coconut or almond milk, topped with sliced strawberries 

_Lunch:_
- Grilled chicken Caesar salad (make sure to use dairy-free dressing and croutons)

_Dinner:_
- Beef stir-fry with a variety of colorful vegetables
- Jasmine rice

_Snack:_
- Apple slices with sunflower seed butter
- A handful of mixed nuts (excluding almonds, pistachios, and cashews)

**Day 6:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Smoothie bowl made with plant-based milk, spinach, frozen mixed berries, and topped with granola (ensure no dairy or honey is used in the granola)

_Lunch:_
- Lentil loaf with a side of steamed green beans
- Roasted root vegetable medley

_Dinner:_
- Pan-seared cod fillet
- Whole grain pasta with marinara sauce and roasted zucchini

_Snack:_
- Celery sticks filled with sunflower seed butter
- Fresh orange segments

**Day 7:**

_Breakfast:_ 
- Buckwheat pancakes topped with fresh blueberries (ensure no dairy is used in the pancakes)

_Lunch:_
- Greek salad with olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, and feta alternative
- Quinoa tabbouleh

_Dinner:_
- Grilled vegetable kebabs with a side of farro
- Roasted Brussels sprouts with balsamic glaze

_Snack:_
- Rice cakes with avocado spread
- Sliced pears

Throughout the week, ensure you're getting a variety of proteins (from eggs, chicken, fish, tofu, legumes), healthy fats (avocados, olive oil, sunflower seed butter), and fiber-rich carbohydrates (whole grains, quinoa, vegetables). Remember to drink plenty of water throughout the day and adjust portion sizes according to your individual needs and activity levels. 

Please note that for some items like salad dressings or processed foods, it is important to check labels as they can sometimes contain hidden ingredients like honey or dairy. When in doubt, you can opt for homemade versions where you have complete control over the ingredients.

It’s always recommended to consult with a healthcare provider or dietitian when planning meals to ensure they meet your nutritional needs and health conditions if any.
